intro: Acroglyphe hispida, commonly known as the hairy acroglyphe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native habitat.
